answers.answer: Hi,Erectile problems may be due to a physical or psychological cause . Do you have problems with erection greater than 25% of the time. You have noted that you do get morning erections and this may be a good sign . Your urologist may be able to help you ascertain the cause .Any underlying disease like diabetes, hypertension?One thing that is significant here is your relationship with your wife.This may contribute to the psychological aspect of your conditon. You may need to see a sex therapist or undergo some counselling to be able to thresh out any conflicts or issues. You may try to discuss with her how you feel about your condition and tell her that you need her support and understanding as you try to find a solution for this.I do hope things will be better. Keep us posted regarding your physician's advise.

question: I am a 43 year old man with what I think is a good sex drive (my desire is strong).  I do get the morning erections but that is as far as my erections go.  If I decide to have intercourse with my wife, the erection dies.  I also can't get one just on a whim with her.  I've taken Levitra (with limited results) and I'm taking Cialis (too early to tell).  Something is going on and I need help.  I do know that my wife doesn't help me in how I feel about things.  She accuses me of being with others and/or masturbating, which by the way, I don't get an erection when I used to masturbate.  I have been frustrated and need answers.  I love her dearly but I know this will make or break our relationship.  Thanks in advance.  If a doctor sees this, could you please respond?
title: help me out please
